quote: 所有大人都曾經是小孩，雖然只有少數人記得。(All grown-ups were once children... but only few of them remember it.)
author: 安托萬·德·聖修伯里 (Antoine de Saint-Exupéry)

quote: 重要的東西用眼睛是看不見的。(What is essential is invisible to the eye.)
author: 安托萬·德·聖修伯里 (Antoine de Saint-Exupéry)

quote: 如果你渴望得到某樣東西，你得讓它自由，如果它回到你身邊，它就是屬於你的，如果它不會回來，你就從未擁有過它。(If you love something, set it free. If it comes back, it's yours. If it doesn't, it never was.)
author: 理查·巴哈 (Richard Bach)
work: 《幻影》(Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah)

quote: 人不是因失敗而打敗，而是因放棄而打敗。(A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.)
author: 約翰·巴里摩爾 (John Barrymore) (此為其名言，常被勵志書籍引用，原文更指夢想與遺憾)

quote: 我們以歷史的眼光看待事物，只因我們活在當下。(We view things from the perspective of history only because we live in the present.)
author: 尤瓦爾·赫拉利 (Yuval Noah Harari)
work: 人類簡史 (Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind)

quote: 知識就是力量。(Knowledge is power.)
author: 法蘭西斯·培根 (Francis Bacon)

quote: 我所知道的唯一真實的智慧，就是知道自己一無所知。(The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.)
author: 蘇格拉底 (Socrates) (柏拉圖轉述)

quote: 習慣形成性格，性格決定命運。(Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny.)
author: 聖雄甘地 (Mahatma Gandhi) (此為其完整觀點的簡化)

quote: 世界上只有一種英雄主義，那就是在認清生活真相之後依然熱愛生活。(There is only one heroism in the world: to see the world as it is and to love it.)
author: 羅曼·羅蘭 (Romain Rolland)

quote: 如果你想了解宇宙的秘密，就從能量、頻率和振動的角度來思考。(If you want to find the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency and vibration.)
author: 尼古拉·特斯拉 (Nikola Tesla)

quote: 一個人可以被毀滅，但不能被打敗。(A man can be destroyed but not defeated.)
author: 厄尼斯特·海明威 (Ernest Hemingway)
work: 老人與海 (The Old Man and the Sea)

quote: 閱讀使人充實，會談使人敏捷，寫作使人精確。(Reading maketh a full man; conference a ready man; and writing an exact man.)
author: 法蘭西斯·培根 (Francis Bacon)

quote: 愛不是凝視彼此，而是一起凝視共同的方向。(Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.)
author: 安托萬·德·聖修伯里 (Antoine de Saint-Exupéry)

quote: 我們的心是懶惰的，很容易就相信那些使我們安逸的東西。(Our minds are lazy, and they believe what is easy rather than what is true.)
author: 卡爾·薩根 (Carl Sagan)

quote: 所謂的聽天由命，是一種得到證實的絕望。(What we call resignation is confirmed desperation.)
author: 亨利·大衛·梭羅 (Henry David Thoreau)

quote: 歷史不會重複自己，但它會押韻。(History doesn't repeat itself, but it often rhymes.)
author: 馬克·吐溫 (Mark Twain) (常被歸功於他)

quote: 一個人畢其一生的努力，就是在整合他童年時代的點點滴滴。(The whole of life is but a patient accumulating of the bits and pieces of childhood.)
author: 卡爾·榮格 (Carl Jung)

quote: 沒有黑暗這種東西，黑暗只是光明的缺席。(There is no such thing as darkness; only a failure to see.)
author: 馬爾科姆· Muggeridge (這句話更常見的版本，原意可能指缺乏理解)

quote: 當你凝視深淵時，深淵也在凝視你。(He who fights with monsters should be careful lest he thereby become a monster. And if thou gaze long into an abyss, the abyss will also gaze into thee.)
author: 弗里德里希·尼采 (Friedrich Nietzsche)

quote: 大多數人過著一種平靜的絕望生活。(The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation.)
author: 亨利·大衛·梭羅 (Henry David Thoreau)

quote: 一個人的真正尺度，是他如何對待那些對他沒有任何好處的人。(The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good.)
author: 塞繆爾·詹森 (Samuel Johnson)

quote: 那些殺不死我的，必使我更強大。(That which does not kill us makes us stronger.)
author: 弗里德里希·尼采 (Friedrich Nietzsche)

quote: 故事講述者統治世界。(Storytellers rule the world.)
author: 柏拉圖 (Plato) (類似觀點，強調敘事的力量)

quote: 我們建造的工具，反過來也塑造我們。(We shape our tools, and thereafter our tools shape us.)
author: 馬歇爾·麥克魯漢 (Marshall McLuhan)

quote: 如果你想快樂一小時，就去睡個午覺。如果你想快樂一天，就去釣魚。如果你想快樂一生，就去幫助別人。(If you want happiness for an hour, take a nap. If you want happiness for a day, go fishing. If you want happiness for a lifetime, help someone.)
author: 中國諺語 (Chinese Proverb)

quote: 恐懼是心靈的殺手。(Fear is the mind-killer.)
author: 法蘭克·赫伯特 (Frank Herbert)

quote: 所有動物生來平等，但有些動物比其他動物更平等。(All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.)
author: 喬治·歐威爾 (George Orwell)

quote: 凡是你抗拒的，都會持續存在。(What you resist, persists.)
author: 卡爾·榮格 (Carl Jung)

quote: 唯一能從歷史中學到的教訓，就是人們從來都無法從歷史中學到任何教訓。(The only thing we learn from history is that we learn nothing from history.)
author: 格奧爾格·黑格爾 (Georg Hegel) (常被如此簡化引用)

quote: 寫作，不過是在靈魂的深處放一張躺椅，然後邀請陌生人進來。(Writing is perhaps the only profession that invites you to place a recliner in the depths of your soul and then invite strangers to come and sit.)
author: 不詳 (對寫作的詩意描述)
